name: The Curve Palm Springs Hotel

reviews.text: Booked as part of a budget package, this was a pleasant surprise. Nice well appointed rooms in Palm Springs with good views for tourists (like us). Friendly staff, two outdoor pools for guests. Decent coffee in rooms & good TVs.
reviews.title: Overall good value - nice views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Travelodge in Palm Springs for one night in late December (just before New Year's). It was a last-minute trip to meet up with friends who were already out in the desert for another friend's birthday. I booked the room via the internet on a Monday for that very same Thursday night and got a Std. King Room for $64/nt! When the Ace Hotel was asking around $175/nt for same, I figured this was worth giving a try. We knew it wouldn't be luxury, but I really like that part of Palm Canyon and thought it was kind of cool that this Travelodge had been here since the 1960s. I even found an old postcard of it from back in the day!
reviews.title: A good value, but morning desk was rude

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived right at sunset and the skies were gorgeous. Check-in was quick & the front desk clerk was friendly and efficient. We were in the building furthest West and our room had a little balcony that overlooked the parking lot (with a couple of outdoor resin chairs on it). The furniture was sort of IKEA-esque, but nice and the bed was decently comfortable. The bathroom still has the original tiled shower stall from the 60s (which has definitely seen better days & is very narrow & close), but I appreciate when a vintage motel keeps a little something of its history. The A/C heating unit is a large window unit and the heat worked very well (we weren't cold at all).
reviews.title: Not bad

reviews.text: It's next door to Lyon's English Grille (great old 60s steakhouse/lounge), the Caliente Tropics hotel (tiki architecture) and a short walk to the Ace Hotel (Amigo Room bar). It's also a quick cab ride or drive into downtown Palm Springs.
reviews.title: we stayed last weekend...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Honestly, this stay started out as a 4-star experience (hovering toward 5-star), until the morning of check-out. When we arrived back to the room at night after dinner & drinks, I called down to the desk to ask for a late check-out (check-out time is noon). The night clerk said that she could give us until 1:00 p.m. I said that would be fine. The next morning, we were leisurely taking showers and answering emails, knowing that we had until 1:00 p.m. to check out. At around 12:10 p.m., I received a call from the desk clerk demanding to know why we hadn't checked out yet. I told her that the night clerk had promised us a 1 p.m. check-out. She immediately barked, "Who did you talk to? What was her name?" I said I didn't know, but it was a woman who was working the night desk shift. She then launched into a 5 minute tirade that started with "Well, there is nothing noted in the computer and I have a full hotel tonite and need everyone checked out already." When I, once again, told her that we had been promised by an employee a 1 p.m. check-out and that we weren't trying to shirk our check-out time (and that I was standing in a towel), she reiterated that she had "no record" of my request and she needed me out of the room IMMEDIATELY. I told her we would do our best & she hung up on me.
reviews.title: Nice for the price

reviews.text: Close to downtown, nice view of mountains.
reviews.title: decent place

reviews.text: Area by the pool and grass is OK, but another bouildings i would rate with one DOT
reviews.title: Making the most of an old roadside motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I picked the Travelodge based on price, because hotel-rates in Palm Springs tend to be very high...especially on weekends. The buildings are old and date back to the 70's or probably even the 60's, which shows in some details, especially in the bathroom. But management really has made the most of the situation. My room was obviously newly renovated with tasteful, contemporary furniture. It had a big screen tv, a refrigerator, lots of shelves and drawers, and plenty of electrical outlets to hook up my computer and all my chargers. Wifi was free. The grounds of the Travelodge are nicely landscaped, and even the two pool areas were inviting, considering those were basically concrete holes in the ground. Breakfast was basic but good. And staff were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay at the Travelodge again.
reviews.title: Coachella Weekend
Be aware of the "Resort Fee"
reviews.text: This is my second time writing a review for the Travelodge. I stayed here during Coachella weekend. I went to the pool both days I was there and had a great experience. They had satellite radio (BPM) playing in the pool area and they also had free ice cold water w/ lemons for everyone, which was really good idea since it was over 100 degrees! The front desk was very helpful with the transportation to and from Coachella. They provided free transportation to Coachella!

They serve free breakfast (bagels, muffins, cereal, etc.). I've read previous comments that complain about the free breakfast (many 5 star hotels don't offer free breakfast!). If you're looking for eggs benedict or french toast, maybe you can drive over to Denny's or another restaurant. Otherwise, this place does the job. They even provide you with coffee in your room! (again, many 5 star hotels don't provide this!).
reviews.title: Chic and quaint Oasis in Palm Desert

reviews.text: The motel has been updated and looks pretty nice it is an old motel but in real good shape. The pool was nice and refreshing, it was a good location for our first stay in Palm Springs
reviews.title: Good economical choice

reviews.text: Our room had problems right away when we arrived, a bed that needed to be replaced and a toilet that had the wrong tank top on it. Small shower (room 122), try to avoid this room. The grounds are well kept and the staff was pleasant enough!
reviews.title: So-So hotel Bad Internet Connection

reviews.text: My star ratings say it all. Its cheap, clean and in a fantastic place. Palm springs is ideal for all the family and this hotel caters for everone.
reviews.title: First class hotel at a great price.

reviews.text: I found this motel to be clean and quiet with a very comfortable bed. The bathroom was clean but it needs to be updated. Years of use and scrubbing make it appear shabby but, let me repeat, it was clean. The pool was delightful in the 108°F heat.
reviews.title: Clean and far from the traffic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the first time on a whim, because it was a busy weekend and no other hotels had rooms available...this is our go-to hotel now! Last summer my boyfriend and I stayed here pretty much every other weekend, and now since summer is starting we are staying more often again. The staff is very friendly and bends over backwards to accomodate their guests and makes them feel welcome. They got to recognize me from being in there so often and made me feel like they appreciated me choosing their hotel. I think CJ and Vanessa are the names of the people I've dealt with most, and they are very pleasant. The rooms are always simple yet clean, and anytime I need to request something from the front desk they help me with no problems. They take care of us every time we're there and we plan to keep staying here for years to come!
reviews.title: Great little place to stay...
Could have been a better experience
reviews.text: The sign out front says "Affordable Hip Rooms". When we walked into our room ( on the back side of the far building), it was definitely NOT screaming HIP. The paint was peeling, the TVs and air conditioner were from the 80's, and our patio (if you could call it that) was practically IN the parking lot. And the free internet didn't work at all during our 3 day stay. I felt a little freaked out about leaving our belongings in the room while we were out.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second night we were there, we decided to check out the hot tub. That's when we realized we were definitely in the wrong part of the motel! The pool area is awesome - with a huge hot tub, outdoor beds, a fire pit with seating, even fresh lemonade! And the rooms facing the pool were definitely more HIP than our room They had new flat screened TVs, recessed lighting, and new paint and furnishings.
reviews.title: Not bad, but don't expect luxury!

reviews.text: My husband went to the office to ask why we were stuck in the back of the motel. The lady told him we could've stayed in a remodeled room for $10 more a night. He politely thanked her for telling us that when we checked it. We would have definitely upgraded if given the chance!
reviews.title: Basic but with problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I think our experience would have been a much better one - who knows- I might even be giving a 4 or 5 star rating, had we been offered another option. Be sure to pay $10 to stay in a remodeled room if you choose to stay here - I'm pretty sure it's worth the money.
reviews.title: Bathroom Needs a Thorough Cleaning
I don't regret staying here
reviews.text: We stayed here 20th-27th March 2012.

description: The Curve Palm Springs is located in America's Desert Playground with classic mid-century modern architecture. We are surrounded by majestic snow capped mountains and extraordinary views. The Curve Palm Springs is located minutes from downtown where you will find world-class shopping, entertainment, dining, fabulous golf, tennis, hiking, other outdoor activities and unlimited sunshine which makes this a desert oasis! Enjoy our casual atmosphere at affordable vacation prices and take in all the desert has to offer. Visit The Curve Palm Springs and make your Palm Springs experience a truly memorable one.
